channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: The scale of Western sanctions caught Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich off guard. “I don’t think he or anyone else expected what would come.” https://t.co/hmULPnctGf
Odessa-based programmer Wang Jixian challenges Chinese fans of Vladimir Putin to put words into action on the battlefield, attracting millions of views https://t.co/07KPTILTiY
Russia said it fired an air-launched ballistic missile on Ukraine in what may have been the first use of the new weapon https://t.co/xygaCqmI4b
Iran set up a clandestine banking system outside the country that handles billions of dollars in banned trade, according to documents and Western officials https://t.co/CItGbd1t59
“Nobody wants to leave the city anymore”: People in this Ukrainian port city are attempting a tentative return to normality after Russian forces were pushed back https://t.co/nbPetFvEZz
Chechen troops had been a feared fighting force, but Ukraine’s defenders are proving to be a match https://t.co/4nRWYkpeg1

A Long Island official said he has found a way to make the first legally authorized shipment of donated firearms from the U.S. to Ukrainians defending themselves against an invasion by Russia https://t.co/DPpMLdl3yO
Russia's invasion of Ukraine forced CEOs into crisis mode. The result was a corporate participation in geopolitics with little recent precedent. https://t.co/onKtMDHPO2
The NBA went crazy over two players’ 60-point games. But weeks earlier, Kansas State’s Ayoka Lee scored 61. She’s about to make her March Madness debut. https://t.co/KXHTHdMFy6
Here is an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal's weekend edition https://t.co/TgVg9wFpox https://t.co/2Z22yOdiCr
From @WSJopinion: Forget about "off-ramps" for Russian aggression against Ukraine. As Clausewitz observed, a key to success is to pursue a retreating enemy, writes @wrmead. https://t.co/JWZWPQJcSI
In the 50 years since "The Godfather" premiered, its themes, characters and filmmaking style continue to influence hit shows—like "Succession," "Yellowstone" and "Ozark." https://t.co/ez44yPUVcC
Subway is under scrutiny after announcing earlier this week that its roughly 450 independently owned franchises in Russia would continue operating in the country https://t.co/Bw0vGr73Bo
Chechen warlord Ramzan Kadyrov’s forces had been a feared fighting force, but Ukraine’s defenders are proving to be a match https://t.co/48flCB8U5D
The scale of Western sanctions caught Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich off guard. “I don’t think he or anyone else expected what would come.” https://t.co/QjJTpUgazH
Alaska Rep. Don Young, the longest-serving Republican in history, has died. He was 88. https://t.co/ggJ9CHIyfi

From @WSJopinion: Using Russian-made S-400s, sold to Turkey with the goal of dividing NATO, to shoot down Russian jets bombing Ukrainian cities would be poetic justice, writes Paul Kolbe https://t.co/H6WOBX7DSi

From @WSJopinion: Let’s see how long it takes Joe Biden to recognize that the Ukraine war has reset energy politics and that his climate agenda risks dooming his party this fall, writes @KimStrassel https://t.co/rijBW7M0Ih
In the 50 years since "The Godfather" premiered, its themes, characters and filmmaking style continue to influence hit shows—like "Succession," "Yellowstone" and "Ozark." https://t.co/bgIqF1A8aP
Morgues overflowing. Crematoria working around the clock. A shortage of coffins. Hong Kong struggles through the world’s highest peak death rates from Covid-19 https://t.co/BzfbDiWThv

Syrian President Bashar al-Assad met with Emirati leaders Friday on a surprise visit to the United Arab Emirates, his first trip to an Arab country since launching a brutal crackdown on opponents that plunged the country into civil war 11 years ago https://t.co/6yZxiPaftk

Unvaccinated MLB players won’t be allowed to enter Canada to play against the Toronto Blue Jays. The rule will provide a glimpse into how many players have declined to take the shots. https://t.co/mDIMXsIama
“Nobody wants to leave the city anymore.” People in this Ukrainian port city are attempting a tentative return to normality after Russian forces were pushed back. https://t.co/HxaauQvRqD
Halliburton has suspended future business in Russia, citing sanctions imposed following Russia's invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/uMSUanKaEb
House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy rebuked Rep. Madison Cawthorn for calling Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, whose country is under attack by Russia, a "thug" https://t.co/hUxIskvyeA via
Russian President Vladimir Putin vowed to press on with his invasion of Ukraine before tens of thousands flag-waving of supporters in a Moscow stadium https://t.co/TGxTUpC6st
In the 50 years since "The Godfather" premiered, its themes, characters and filmmaking style continue to influence hit shows—like "Succession," "Yellowstone" and "Ozark." https://t.co/dib1xmvm8s
Chechen warlord Ramzan Kadyrov’s forces had been a feared fighting force, but Ukraine’s defenders are proving to be a match https://t.co/bCqXNAtSNo

Italian police seized a real-estate complex owned by sanctioned Russian oligarch Alexey Mordashov. The complex of residential buildings, with an estimated value of around €105 million ($116 million), is located in Portisco, the police said. https://t.co/hxPO42Zeo2
Iran set up a clandestine banking system outside the country that handles billions of dollars in banned trade, according to documents and Western officials https://t.co/ns5rU3gu0J
Gambling regulators in two states say they are looking into Barstool and Penn National amid sexual-misconduct accusations against Barstool’s founder https://t.co/zJxa7J2ZXq

President Biden and Chinese leader Xi Jinping conferred Friday amid growing hostility over Ukraine and what the U.S. says is Beijing’s failure to join other leading nations in denouncing Russia’s military assault on Ukraine https://t.co/wW6i64l68K

President Vladimir Putin addressed tens of thousands of supporters at a Moscow stadium, justifying the invasion of Ukraine he ordered and arguing the operation where Russia is sustaining heavy losses is going to plan https://t.co/QcPmTXIpej
Ivermectin got loads of attention from celebrities like Joe Rogan as a way to treat Covid-19, but a large study has questioned its effectiveness https://t.co/NKuKFZjaJQ
Workers rescued 130 people from a Ukrainian theater that was hit by a Russian airstrike. About 1,300 remained trapped in the basement. https://t.co/wYjaSekAne
The palatial and ornate Manhattan mansions depicted on the hit HBO series ‘The Gilded Age’ once existed, but almost all have been demolished https://t.co/JARnza5dVK
From @WSJopinion: China has picked the wrong horse, and it has shown again in Ukraine, as in Hong Kong, that it can’t be trusted. The West should respond accordingly. https://t.co/pGdTl9bxcE

The House passed legislation to strip Russia and Belarus of their most-favored-nation trade status, which could result in higher import tariffs on some products from those countries #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/S1JXS5Nna2 https://t.co/IRzseaTiQe

Rescue workers have freed 130 people from the destroyed theater in Mariupol, Lyudmyla Denisova, Ukraine’s ombudsman, said Friday, following a Russian airstrike on the building. She declined to confirm any fatalities. https://t.co/4EtZgS7Kb5
Most medical debts will be removed from consumers’ credit reports, easing a burden that makes it harder for millions of Americans to borrow https://t.co/iQmh8wq7eZ
“Nobody wants to leave the city anymore.” People in this Ukrainian port city are attempting a tentative return to normality after Russian forces were pushed back. https://t.co/76Iw3Smk2l
Morgues overflowing. Crematoria working around the clock. A shortage of coffins. Hong Kong struggles through the world’s highest peak death rates from Covid-19 https://t.co/sNwcxDkWjt

Unvaccinated MLB players won’t be allowed to enter Canada to play against the Toronto Blue Jays. The rule will provide a glimpse into how many players have declined to take the shots. https://t.co/trZuP4TBw6

French President Emmanuel Macron said he planned to increase the legal retirement age to 65 from the current 62, raising a controversial issue three weeks before national elections https://t.co/S7puf6MQxV

The president of Restaurant Brands International said his company has demanded the suspension of Burger King restaurant operations in Russia, but that the main operator of its joint venture has refused to do so https://t.co/edwYhrITlW
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/ccw6j5rEoT
From @WSJopinion: The U.S. should revise its strategy to set the stage for negotiating a palatable solution between Russia and Ukraine, writes Zalmay Khalilzad https://t.co/EvhkdF5qDU

Kentucky is still a place for one-and-dones. For years, that meant talented freshmen exiting for the NBA after a single season. In 2022, it means a shocking one-game exit from the NCAA tournament. https://t.co/1xYw6HmqIO

Walmart wants to hire around 50,000 workers in the U.S. in the current quarter, the company said, as the country’s largest private employer pushes to expand its retail and other businesses in the midst of a tight labor market https://t.co/EA9LDHyxOQ
Koch Industries said its subsidiary Guardian Industries will keep operating two glass manufacturing plants in Russia that employ 600 people https://t.co/2i9mCW9OTB
